title: Drawing, 1524–46
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on off-white laid paper
markings: Watermark: anchor in ovoid, topped by a five-lobed leaf over 3C (RB '45).
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, verso: Les Dessins taient coll s emplein sur un carton, on les a d colles / en conservant l'entourage de Mariette
provenance: From the Collection of P.J. Mariette (Lugt 1852); Count J.P van Suchtelen (Lugt 2332); Hippolyte Destailleur (Collection no. 493); Leon Decloux, Sevres
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A ship-shaped bowl, supported by two mermaids, is surmounted upon a base representing the sea. The bowl is flanked by two high columns with mermaid finials connected to each other by a pole entwined with ribbon. Traces of framing lines are visible at the edges of the sketch.

exhibitions.title: Nancy and Edwin Marks Collection Gallery: Treasures from the Collection
The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1524–46.
1524–46. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, black chalk on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-169.
